headline: Canadian Yellow Split Pea Soup with Ham
name: Canadian Yellow Split Pea Soup with Ham
description: Canadian-style yellow split pea soup is a great way to use up a ham bone, or smoked pork hocks. This hearty comforting soup is loaded with flavor.
recipeIngredient: 1 pinch ground black pepper, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place ham bone, yellow split peas, celery, carrots, onion, salt, thyme, bay leaf, and pepper into a large pot; pour in water. Bring mixture to a boil and skim off any foam with a spoon.
Reduce heat and place a lid on the pot, slightly ajar to allow some evaporation. Simmer, stirring occasionally, until yellow split peas are tender and soup is thick, about 3 hours.
Remove ham bone from soup; remove meat from ham bone, chop or shred, and return to the pot.
